messages.title: Campaigning all year round
messages.content: My priorities are to build a strong and sustainable economic recovery with high quality jobs, affordable housing, better local transport and tackling anti-social behaviour. Things that matter to all of us.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: A sustainable economic recovery with high quality jobs for local people.
Investing in schools, training, apprenticeships and SureStart for young people - our future.
Restoring the earnings link for pensions and protecting the winter fuel allowance, bus passes and other help for pensioners.
More frequent and affordable public transport in Leeds West.
Ensuring that local families have a chance of buying or renting a decent home in our area.

issues.economy: A sustainable economic recovery with high quality jobs.
issues.education: Investing in schools, training, apprenticeships and SureStart for young people.
issues.health: 21st century health services right on our doorstep - with district health centres offering first rate treatment.
issues.socialWelfare: Support for hardworking families through Minimum Wage, Winter Fuel Allowance, Tax credits, SureStart - Labour policies that have made a difference for everyone.

housing.content: Ensuring that local families have a chance of buying or renting a decent home in our area.

endorsements.endorsement: From working with Rachel, I know that she is a tireless campaigner for Leeds West. I couldn’t think of anyone better to hand over the responsibility of representing our area.

images.caption: Rachel Reeves with John Battle in front of a library.
Rachel Reeves talking with a group of people.
Investment in schools, hospitals and local services.
